name: Hoarding
description: In Memoir of a Snail Grace Pudel's collection of guinea pigs and ornamental snails gets out of hand. We all have emotional connection to the objects we collect, but why do we decide to carry these items throughout our lives, and when does a collection become a hoard?

key_work.title: Memoir of a Snail
key_work.creator_credit: Adam Elliot, Bill Murphy, Liz Kearney and Arenamedia
key_work.brief_description: In 1970s Australia, Grace’s life is troubled by misfortune and loss. After their mother dies during pregnancy, she and her twin brother, Gilbert, are raised by their paraplegic-alcoholic former juggler father, Percy. Despite a life filled with love, tragedy strikes anew when Percy passes away in his sleep. The siblings are forcibly separated and thrust into separate homes.

end.title: Unpacking
end.brief_description:
Unpacking is a zen puzzle game about the familiar experience of pulling possessions out of boxes and fitting them into a new home. Part block-fitting puzzle, part home decoration, you are invited to create a satisfying living space while learning clues about the life you’re unpacking.

Over the course of eight house moves, you are given a chance to experience a sense of intimacy with a character you never see and a story you’re never told.

links.description: While Marie Kondo strives to declutter lives, the game Unpacking demonstrates that it is the items that we hold onto throughout our lives that make a house a home. By organising boxes of the character’s belongings as they move into different houses over their lifetime, players are able to learn about the character’s interests, hobbies and experiences.

links.description: Hoarder on the Border reflects the trend for Oosouji, meaning “big cleaning” in Japanese culture. The main objective of oosouji is to declutter and purify your home space. In her 2019 TV series Marie Kondo asked viewers “Does this spark joy?”, encouraging them to discard household items that they did not love and need.

start.brief_description: The story follows Maria - a teenager whose mother used to be a hoarder. Now (set in the 90s) she lives in a foster home where a previous resident Michael inspires her to revisit her childhood memories and passions that she has repressed.

links.description: While Hoard focuses on the after effects of living with a hoarder, Hoarder on the Border focuses on the clean up. Unhappy with his life as a piano teacher Ritsuki joins a domestic cleaning company that cleans up the trash-filled houses of an eccentric cast of hoarders who are encouraged to start afresh.
